p: One hundred and forty-nine species were mentioned for different kind of diseases by 271 informants, interviewed during this study. Of these, 125 species were reported by fewer than 8 informants and therefore were excluded for further discussion. The rest of the 24 species were reported by more than 7 informants ( Table 3). For species cited by 8 to 62 informants, the number of uses per species increased progressively ( S1 Fig) with increasing number of informants interviewed showing positive correlation (r, 0.149). Conversely, species mentioned by more than 65 informants, the average number of uses per species did not increase with increasing number of informants. About sixteen plant species mentioned by 62 informants were grouped as unpopular whereas, eight species reported by 65 or more informants were classified as popular.
